item.title: Drain is raised above newly resurfaced road so water pools along the entire side of road, 22nd January
item.description:
Alomg the fron of numbers 38 to 40. Puddle forms a few inches deep with relatively light rain. Makes parking there a nightmare aswell as cross the road having to jump over. Would be concerned for the properties if a heavy downpour.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Linworth Road, Bishop's Cleeve
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: No rain in 24 hours - water has increased or remained the same

item.title: Large pothole on the raised speed cushions, 22nd January
item.description:
The first pair of speed cushions as you leave Ambleside Road/street in the direction of Chosen Hill school. Even when slow to drive over speed cushion; cannot safely navigate around the pothole without venturing across centre of road
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Brookfield Road, Churchdown, Tewkesbury

item.title: At least 30cm x 30cm, 22nd January
item.description:
The same pot hole year in year out, just dig up the hole section
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 73, Ermin Street, Brockworth, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dangerous large potholes, 22nd January
item.description:
Very dangerous large potholes. Deeper than tennis ball. Causing traffic issues especially as London Road (A40) is closed. A school is very close by with children walking, numerous cars parked, blocked traffic whilst trying to avoid these huge potholes. Need fixing ASAP. The length of Hearne Road needs fully resurfacing. Over 10 deep big potholes. Sadly can only upload 3 pictures.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 5, Hearne Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Numerous DEEP BUG potholes, 22nd January
item.description:
There are so many big deep potholes on the length of Hearne Road, over 10. They are deeper than a tennis ball. They are dangerous. The road is very close to schools. And as A40 is closed at one end of Hearne Rd it is getting used far more. The road closure is causing huge issues and the state of this road is making the situation even harder for all. Especially when dark and full of water. This road is a disgrace and the entire road needs resurfacing.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 17, Hearne Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Persistent flooding due to lack of drain, 22nd January
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): A435, Bishop's Cleeve
